name: James K. Zimmerman
bio: James K. Zimmerman was born and raised in Illinois, and he currently resides in the New York City area. He earned a BA in psychology from Oberlin College. After a career as a singer/songwriter, producer, arranger, and performer, Zimmerman earned a PhD in clinical psychology from CUNY. He is the author of Little Miracles (Passager Books, 2015) and Family Cookout (Comstock, 2016), winner of the Jessie Bryce Niles Chapbook Competition. Zimmerman has read his poetry in many venues, including Poet's House, KGB Bar, the Cornelia Street Café, LIU/Post, St. Francis College, and the University of Baltimore.
